moves.1. e4: E4, I am now meeting this with a Sicillian, and have had decent results so far
moves.1... c5 2. Nf3 d6 3. d4 cxd4 4. Nxd4 Nf6: So this is the standard position in the Najdorf and now comes the 6th move
moves.6. Be3: Black has several options but I normally play Nbd7
moves.6... Nbd7 7. f3: This move stops the knight popping onto g4
moves.7... e5 8. Nb3 b5 9. a4 b4 10. Nd5 Bb7: I am happy with my position at the moment although I should have pushed the h pawn here
moves.11. Nxb4 Be7 12. Be2 O-O: I put the king to bed
moves.21. Nc5 Nd7 22. Be3 Nxc5 23. Bxc5 Qxc5+: The bishop stops white from supporting the pawn with the rook
moves.30. Rc3 Rb3b2 31. Qe3 Qd4: White resigns as he is going to lose another piece
